CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from o-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 .

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Material Name" entities:

1. PSFDTBT: This is the name of the material being studied, which is a type of organic semiconductor.
2. DCB: This is the name of the solvent or solution used to spin-cast the PSFDTBT film.

So, the two "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. PSFDTBT
2. DCB
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure! Here are the entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name":

1. PSFDTBT

So, the only entity that clearly refers to a "Material Name" in the paragraph is:

1. PSFDTBT

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name", presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from o-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 .

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. PSFDTBT: This is the name of the material or substance being studied, which is a type of polymer.
2. DCB: This is the name of the solvent or solution used to spin-cast the PSFDTBT film.
3. hole mobility: This is a property of the PSFDTBT material, which refers to the rate at which holes (electrons) can move through the material.
4. on/off ratios: This is another property of the PSFDTBT material, which refers to the ratio of the conductivity of the material when it is "on" (i.e., in an conductive state) to its conductivity when it is "off" (i.e., in a non-conductive state).
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to material properties in the given paragraph:

1. PSFDTBT: This is the name of the material or substance being studied, which refers to its material properties.
2. hole mobility: This is a property of the PSFDTBT material, which refers to the rate at which holes (electrons) can move through the material.

So, the two entities that refer to material properties in the paragraph are:

1. PSFDTBT
2. hole mobility

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| hole mobility |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

In the given paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Property Value" entities:

2. On/off ratios: The on/off ratios of the PSFDTBT film are mentioned as being in the order of 10^5.

Therefore, the two "Property Value" entities in the given paragraph are:

1. Mobility: 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V-1 s^-1
2. On/off ratios: 10^5

This is the value of the mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film.

Therefore, the only entity that refers to the value of a material property in the given paragraph is:
